title: Deeply Disappointed by Racial Bias in Ai YouCam
review:
Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

I recently downloaded the Ai YouCam photo editing app, hoping to enhance my photos and have some fun with the various filters and effects. However, I was deeply disappointed and offended by the racial bias that seems to be ingrained in the app's AI.

Every time I used the app, it would alter my appearance to resemble either an Asian or a white person. It consistently added straight hair to my photos, completely disregarding my natural curls. Moreover, the app consistently lightened my skin tone, which I found extremely offensive.

It appears that the AI in this app is programmed to adhere to white-centric and Asian beauty standards, completely ignoring the beauty and diversity of other races and ethnicities. This is not only disappointing but also deeply problematic, as it perpetuates harmful stereotypes and biases.

The developers of this app need to address this issue immediately. It's 2023. 

The app also seems to have a limited understanding of diverse facial features. It consistently altered my selfie to fit a more Eurocentric or Asian standard. This is not only offensive but also a gross misrepresentation of global beauty standards. My ‚Äúselfie‚Äù did not look remotely close to me. 

Moreover, the app lacks options for different hair textures. It always defaults to straight hair, completely ignoring the beauty of curly, coily, or wavy hair types that are prevalent in various ethnic groups. This is a clear indication of the app's bias towards certain beauty standards, which is highly problematic.

The skin lightening feature is another glaring issue. It seems to promote the harmful notion that lighter skin is more desirable, which is a deeply rooted issue in many societies. This feature perpetuates colorism, a form of discrimination based on skin color, which is already a significant problem worldwide.

In conclusion, the Ai YouCam photo editing app is not inclusive and does not cater to the diverse beauty standards that exist globally. It is essential for the developers to address these issues and ensure that their app is representative of all users, regardless of their race or ethnicity. Until then, I cannot recommend this app to anyone who values diversity and inclusivity.
